os_type: This read-only variable holds one of various constant GameMaker Studio 2 has to tell you which operating system the game has been created for. Note that this is not necessarily the same as the OS of the device running it, since - for example - your game could be running on an Amazon Fire OS, but will have been built for the Android platform (in which case os_type will be os_android).
The following constants can be returned:

{ANY_CODE} switch (os_type)
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}case os_windows: global.Config = 0; break;
{nbsp_x3}case os_android: global.Config = 1; break;
{nbsp_x3}case os_linux: global.Config = 2; break;
{nbsp_x3}case os_macosx: global.Config = 3; break;
{nbsp_x3}case os_ios: global.Config = 4; break;
{nbsp_x3}case os_winphone: global.Config = 5; break;
{nbsp_x3}}
The above code checks the OS running the game and sets a global variable accordingly.
